questions.text: Which Ohio native was the first man to walk on the moon?
questions.explanation: Neil Armstrong, born in Wapakoneta, Ohio, made history on July 20, 1969.

questions.text: John Glenn became the first American to do what?
questions.explanation: In 1962, aboard Friendship 7, John Glenn orbited the Earth three times.

questions.text: The Wright Brothers, pioneers of aviation, were from which Ohio city?
questions.explanation: Orville and Wilbur Wright lived and worked in Dayton, Ohio.

questions.text: Which NASA center is located in Cleveland, Ohio?
questions.explanation: Originally Lewis Research Center, it was renamed after John Glenn in 1999.

questions.text: How old was John Glenn when he returned to space in 1998?
questions.explanation: At 77, he became the oldest person to fly in space aboard the Shuttle Discovery.

questions.text: Neil Armstrong's famous quote: 'That's one small step for [a] man, one giant _____ for mankind.'
Judith Resnik, who tragically died in the Challenger disaster, was from which Ohio city?
questions.explanation: Judith Resnik was an engineer and astronaut from Akron.

questions.text: Which Wright Brothers invention was critical to controlling flight?
questions.explanation: Their breakthrough was three-axis control, allowing the pilot to steer effectively.

questions.text: What is the name of the museum in Wapakoneta dedicated to Neil Armstrong?
questions.explanation: The Armstrong Air & Space Museum opened in 1972.

questions.text: Jim Lovell, of Apollo 13 fame, is from which Ohio city?
Approximately how many astronauts has Ohio produced?
questions.explanation: Ohio is known as the 'Birthplace of Aviation' and has produced 25+ astronauts.

questions.text: The National Museum of the U.S. Air Force is located at which base?
questions.explanation: It is located near Dayton at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base.

questions.text: Sunita Williams, record holder for spacewalks by a woman, hails from:
questions.explanation: She considers Needham, MA her home but was born in Euclid, Ohio.

questions.text: What was the name of the Apollo 11 Lunar Module?
Before becoming an astronaut, John Glenn served as a U.S. Senator for:

options.D: He was a Senator AFTER being an astronaut

questions.explanation: Wait, trick question. He was an astronaut (1959), THEN a Senator (1974-1999), THEN an astronaut again (1998). So D is the best fit for the sequence, or C for the duration (24 years).

questions.text: John Glenn served as a U.S. Senator for Ohio for how many years?
questions.explanation: He served four consecutive terms from 1974 to 1999.
